positions.description:
I was the Deputy Director for Policy and Regulatory Affairs in the Office of the Executive Secretariat and Regulatory Affairs within the Immediate Office of the Secretary of the Interior.

I worked with offices within the Executive Office of the President (EOP), including the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (OIRA) within the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) and the Council on Environmental Quality (CEQ) to represent the regulatory interests of the Department of the Interior and its bureaus and offices. 

I served as a resource within the Department of the Interior on matters related to regulations and policy.

I worked with all bureaus and offices within the Department of the Interior. This included regulations and policy documents from the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, the National Park Service, the Bureau of Indian Affairs, the Office of Insular Affairs, the Office of Hawaiian Affairs, the Bureau of Land Management, the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, the Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement, the Office of Natural Resources Revenue, the Office of Surface Mining Reclamation and Enforcement, the Bureau of Reclamation, and the U.S. Geological Survey.
positions.title: Deputy Director, Policy and Regulatory Affairs, Exec Sec & Reg Affairs, Office of the Secretary

positions.description: I was an expert on regulatory matters within the Minerals Management Service.  I analyzed existing policies and practices in light of statutes, regulations, Executive Orders, and DOI policy.  I drafted regulations and policy documents.  I worked with the Federal Register, the Small Business Administration, and the Office of Management and Budget on matters related to regulations and policy.  I trained offices on regulatory law and practices.
positions.title: Senior Regulatory Analyst

positions.description:
I facilitated an international effort that involved American, European, Canadian, Japanese, and Australian aviation authorities as well as industry representatives from all major airlines and aircraft manufacturers to develop rules to govern long-range commercial air travel.

I coordinated action between the Federal Aviation Administration, the National Park Service, tribal interests, and others to develop regulations for commercial air tours over Grand Canyon National Park.

I helped develop safety regulations for commercial air tours.

I served on the Rapid Response Team for airport security immediately following the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001.
positions.title: Office of Rulemaking

positions.description:
I was the President's principal advisor on all legal, financial, marketing, regulatory compliance, strategic planning, human resources, and communications matters.

I served as the principal contact for all communications with the public and press for community relation purposes and during crisis management.

I drafted legal documents, negotiated joint ventures, worked with outside counsel on litigation, and represented the company in regulatory matters.

I significantly improved the company's cash flow by negotiating favorable terms with creditors and restructuring the company's debt, increasing revenue from the company's website, and improving procedures for bidding on large group contracts.

I negotiated major contracts, including aerial filming contracts for several major movies.
positions.title: General Counsel and Senior Advisor to the President

positions.description: General office practice including estate planning, real estate transactions, representation before the Hawaii Public Utilities Commission, aviation law, buying and selling small businesses, setting up and providing legal counsel to corporations, and legal services to nonprofit organizations.
positions.title: Attorney

Services included counsel and financial analysis for real estate and oil and gas syndications, research and analysis for complex tax situations, financial analysis for municipal bonds, and litigation support.  I developed some of the first spreadsheet applications for Touche Ross in the early days of the personal computer.
